reviewText: Our 17mo loves dancing and mimicking gestures they do. It is amazing to see him grow and enjoy their music. We play these in the car and at home, what a hit!  A definite recommendation to parents looking for entertaining music for their little ones!

My godson, loves the Wiggles!  It has become increasingly hard to find DVD's in stores.  I love Amazon for this very exact reason!  He's now entertained with this great 3 DVD pack that has all of his favorites!
Bought this! My son loves it. However, I misplaced it somewhere...
My 18 month old daughter loves these.
The dvd is really dated but still fun for the little one.

This is great with 3 dvd's, my daughter can watch one until she's bored with it, then the next week she'll watch a different one. by the time we get back to the first one, she's excited to see it again lol!
Great

This is a great DVD for the entire family because the kids can teach the adults the songs!  The Wiggles are amazing and so easy for kids to watch and totally enjoy!
These are movies for my son . He Loves them all and watches them all the time . Very Nice
I got this for my daughters children and she called me asking where I'd found this CD set.  We talked about how inappropriate it was and she threw it out.
Always fun - my 2 yr old grandson has already learned most of the songs and watches it at nap time daily.
I don't think it is exciting enough for my 13 month old. I think he is too young for this set yet. It is not as jam packed with fun like the new Wiggles dvds. Still good stuff!
Perfect combination of all of the best of the Wiggles.  My 2nd grandson loves them as much as his brother did.  The 3-pack offered an excellent price for a comprehensive set.
Great DVD - Granddaughter loves the Wiggles and added this one to her collection. Great to sing and dance too for kids of all ages

These set comes with the best and most popular videos of The Wiggles. It comes with: You Make me feel like Dancing, The Big Red Car, and Wiggle Time. All three are the best out there. My daughters love all three, but their favorite is You Make me feel like Dancing. They can watch it over and over again for ever!!! I even enjoy it too! They dance until they drop! We even dance with them too! Awesome entertainment for kids. Good buy for the price too, as you will be saving some bucks if were to buy the three all separate.
My daughter loves the Wiggles and these were great for long road trips.  She can watch these over and over.  Handy to have on a mobile device to keep her occupied.

My 20 months old twins love the Wiggles.  They watch the Wiggles everyday twice a day!  They were so tough on the DVDs I had to buy a second box set as the previous ones were eventually ruined.  I have a few other wiggles DVDs but these 3 are really the best!  I may have to buy a third set if they can't stop grabbing the discs.  Good price for a great collection!
We were very pleased and my Grandson enjoys this DVD very much. I would recommend this product for any young children.

This is coming from a grown up aimed at other grown ups who might have to sit through hours and hours of repeated playing of these shows. Even though this is the remake of Wiggle Time, the original is so charming in a home made cardboard car sort of way, the shows from this era with their mix of simple colorful sets and some computer effects are easy on the nerves. This is where a lot of the songs and clips we know them for come from. Greg Page's happy dance at the beginning of Get Ready to Wiggle is about one of the most joyful things you'll ever see. You Make Me Feel Like Dancing is one of the better shows from the Sam era. The Shimmy Shake is one of his best Wiggles numbers he doesn't use his opera voice for and he looks like he's enjoying this one a bit more. The show is well paced and they go from disco to ballroom to ballet showing off different dances and hopefully getting you off the couch to do something. It might be turning off the DVD during Minnie the Moocher, instrumental, if the cat noises get to be too much. I like the credits where we hear what The Wiggles' favorite parts are and get to see the people inside Wags, Henry, and Dorothy. It's Here Comes the Big Red Car that starts off well then drives off a cliff. It's a remake of The Wiggles - Dance Party which is interesting as it's the oldest show available and proves just how much it's the Wiggles themselves that drive the show. Yes it's the same Anthony, his book How I Got My Wiggle Back: A Memoir of Healing chronicles the transformation. Things in HCBRC go fine as long as it's The Wiggles and their friends in moderation, it's the pirate crew that wear on adult nerves. On one hand you can try and figure out who are the characters, Wags, Henry, and Dorothy are among them, and who are the Wiggles' and Captain Feathersword's understudies. (kids might ask why Sam is a pirate and not a Wiggle here) On the other hand you might wish the SS Feathersword would capsize just to see who among them would sink or swim. One of the pirates was still touring with them by 2012 Celebration and it wasn't Sam.
great item
My nephew won't stop playing these videos.
kids loved it
Godson Loved it!!
For the grand kids.

You may be squeamish at watching a bunch of guys sing and dance around and no doubt many of the stories and skits are silly, but this is good clean fun for your kids with very singable original songs and good clean messages. There is respect for adults, encouraging kids to eat their vegi's, no making fun of each other at the other's expense, learning how to cross the road the right way... lots of other messages in a fun presentation. My kids loved this and I still have the songs stuck in my head although we haven't played this for a year or so. I bought this for my brother and his new baby because it is now one of my standard new child gifts.
My 21 month old loves dancing to the wiggles!
Great price and a good value. Shipped on time.
Kids like it.

Overall, our child (toddler) loves these though is more of a fan of the current Wiggles (Emma, Lachy, Simon, Anthony) lineup. This was a great deal as well. I saw another reviewer mention that the parts with Captain Feathersword are a bit long and I can confirm this; our child starts to lose interest during these parts but still enjoys them overall.
